intro: Odontarrhena cyprica, commonly known as the Cyprus odontarrhena, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cyprus. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open woodland or scrub habitats. Odontarrhena cyprica is notable for its historical use in traditional medicine and its role in the local biodiversity of Cyprus.
